item.title: Report X-2023090232
item.description:
Report X-2023090232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO UNLOAD WEARING FULL PPE AND FOUND BOX WITH UPPER CORNER WET WITH FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 LABEL. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 PACKAGE. NO LIQUID FROM PACKAGE ON FLOOR TO CLEAN UP, TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART PRIOR TO PROCESSING THE DAMAGE THROUGH THE DMP.

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-03
  • City: FRIEDENS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING INTRANSIT PORTION OF LOAD MOVEMENT PRESSURE BUILD UP DUE TO TEMPETURE AND PRODUCT MOVEMENT CAUSED PRV TO VENT SOME MATERIAL INTO DOME COVER AREA OF CTMV. RELEASE DISCOVERED BY DRIVER DURING UNIT INSPECTION ENROUTE. PRV RECLOSED AND RELEASE CLEANED PROPERLY. NO ADDITIONAL INCIDENTS AND MATERIAL UNLOADED SAFELY AT CONSIGNEE.

Report E-2023090591

  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHILE PRESSURING CT FOR UNLOADING AT CONSIGNEE, GASKET ON DISCHARGE LINE FAILED RELEASING MATERIAL INTO CONTAINMENT AREA. UNLOADING STOPPED. CTMV RETURNED TO TERMINAL WHERE GASKET WAS REPLACED. SECOND DELIVERY ATTEMPT WAS COMPLETED WITHOUT INCIDENT

item.title: Report E-2023090588
item.description:
Report E-2023090588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN2922 was crushed during transit and released its full contents to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized absorbent pads, a sprayer, and a neutralizing solution to wipe down all freight and the impacted floor of the trailer and dock until the surfaces tested neutral and were sufficiently remediated. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All three (3) containers of waste were labeled appropriately and staged on-site.

item.title: Report X-2023090313
item.description:
Report X-2023090313

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading package, a package handler dropped the package causing the leak. DescribePack: Damaged cap about the size of a dime. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA obtained a hazmat bin and put the leaking hazmat in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090281
item.description:
Report X-2023090281

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a red hazardous material tote. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box. DescribePack: There is a big wet spot at the bottom of the package. The jerrican was in a plastic bag with a zip tie. I pulled the jerrican out of the bag and there were at least 2 liters of liquid at the bottom of the bag. I turn the Jerrican upside down to see where the leak was coming from. It leaked out from the cap. The cap was not fully completely secured on the jerrican. DurationRel: 21 and MitigateEffect: kept upright to prevent any more leaks

item.title: Report X-2023090273
item.description:
Report X-2023090273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found by a QA member on the dock when it was about to be loaded onto the truck. The top of the box was corroding due to one of the bottles tops being loose. The hazmat was put into a bin to stop any leakage and placed into the damage hazmat cage to process. DescribePack: One of the bottles caps were loose and the liquid leaked out on to the top of the box and on the other bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was put into a bin to stop any liquid from spreading and placed into the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090259
item.description:
Report X-2023090259

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in the unload loaded on its side. It was discovered leaking in trailer and brought to QA's attention. QA identified the hazardous labeling and placed it in a salvage drum in the Hazmat Cage. DescribePack: One of the gallons in the box had a slightly loose cap with no seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained and brought to QA in a haz tote and then transferred to a yellow salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023090458
item.description:
Report X-2023090458

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon jug of sodium hydroxide (un1824) had been crushed by other freight and had released 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023090635
item.description:
Report E-2023090635

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: HAZLE TOWNSHIP
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This drum arrived back to the origin terminal and was being moved onto another trailer. During this process, the drum was punctured by a forklift. The drum was immediately placed turned onto it's side to prevent further release and was then overpacked to contain the drum. The released material was neutralized and containerized for proper disposal. Due to the hazard of the material, the packaging specs could not be safely obtained.

Report X-2023081934

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer and QA was called over for a leaking hazmat. Associate went over to unload area, used protective gloves and placed package into hazmat container and brought package to QA. DescribePack: Box came to QA with top and bottom closure wet with liquid from inside box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed upright in hazmat container and brought to QA

item.title: Report X-2023081918
item.description:
Report X-2023081918

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection on inner contents 1 X 3.79 liter plastic bottle of gram decolorizer had a loose cap allowing 1 liter of liquid to release. The bottle was in a plastic bag. No slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Plastic bottle of gram decolorizer had a loose lid leaking out 1 liter of liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.
